acquireYieldContract(bytes32).details: Acquire a yield contract in the open market

params._contractId: - The Id of the contract Non Reentrant modifier is used to prevent re-entrancy attack

addErc20(address,uint256).details: Adds a supported ERC20 address into the contract

params._mFactor: - Mint Factor of the token (value of 1 token in USD * 10 power 18)

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion

addErc20List(address[],uint256[]).details: Adds a list of supported ERC20 addresses into the contract

params._erc20AddressList: - List of addresses of the ERC20 contract
params._mFactorList: - List of mint factors of the token

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion

claimYieldContract(bytes32).details: Claim a yield contract in the active market

params._contractId: - The Id of the contract Non Reentrant modifier is used to prevent re-entrancy attack

params._collateral: - The collateral value of the ERC20 token or ETH
params._erc20Address: - The address of the ERC20 token (ZERO_ADDRESS if ETH)
params._tenure: - The number of days of the agreement

destroyOMContract(bytes32).details: Destroy an open market yield contract

params._contractId: - The Id of the contract Non Reentrant modifier is used to prevent re-entrancy attack
- The Id of the contract Non Reentrant modifier is used to prevent re-entrancy attack

getNoOfErc20s().details: Returns number of valid Tokens/Coins supported

getSubsetErc20List(uint256,uint256).details: Returns subset list of valid ERC20 contracts

params._end: - End index to search in the list
params._start: - Start index to search in the list

returns._0: - List of valid ERC20 addresses subset

getSubsetYieldContracts(uint256,uint256).details: This function will subset of yield contract

returns._0: - List of subset yield contract Access Control: Public

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeErc20(address).details: Removes a valid ERC20 addresses from the contract

params._erc20Address: - Address of the ERC20 contract to be removed

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.      * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setErc20Validity(address,bool).details: Enlists/Delists ERC20 address to prevent adding new yield contracts with this ERC20 collateral

params._isValid: - New validity boolean of the ERC20 contract

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion

setInterest(uint256,uint64).details: This function will set interest rate for the tenure in days

params._interestRate: - Interest rate in 10 power 6 (If 5%, then value is 0.05 * 10 power 6)
params._tenure: - Tenure of the agreement in days

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion Access Control: Only Owner

setParamType(uint8,uint256).details: This function will set value based on ParamType

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion Access Control: Only Owner

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateMFactor(address,uint256).details: Updates the mint factor of a coin/token

params._erc20Address: - Address of the ERC20 contract or ETH address (ZERO_ADDRESS)

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion

updateMFactorList(address[],uint256[]).details: Updates the mint factor for list of coin(s)/token(s)

params._mFactorList: - List of mint factors for ERC20 addresses

returns._0: - Boolean status - True indicating successful completion

withdrawMXX(uint256).details: This function will withdraw MXX back to the owner

params._amount: - Amount of MXX need to withdraw

returns._0: - Boolean status indicating successful completion Access Control: Only Owner

addErc20List(address[],uint256[]).notice: - The length of _erc20AddressList and _mFactorList must be the same- Access control: Only Owner

createYieldContract(address,uint256,uint.notice: - Collateral to be input - Actual value * (10 power decimals)- For e.g If collateral is 5 USDT (Tether) and decimal is 6, then _collateral is (5 * (10 power 6)) Non Reentrant modifier is used to prevent re-entrancy attack- Access control: External

updateMFactorList(address[],uint256[]).notice: - Length of the 2 input arrays must be the same- Access control: Only Owner

userdoc.notice: TO NOTEStore collateral and provide interest MXX or burn MXXInterest (contractFee, penaltyFee etc) is always represented 10 power 6 times the actual valueNote that only 4 decimal precision is allowed for interestIf interest is 5%, then value to input is 0.05 * 10 pow 6 = 5000mFactor or mintFactor is represented 10 power 18 times the actual value.If value of 1 ETH is 380 USD, then mFactor of ETH is (380 * (10 power 18))Collateral should always be in its lowest denomination (based on the coin or Token)If collateral is 6 USDT, then value is 6 * (10 power 6) as USDT supports 6 decimalsstartTime and endTime are represented in Unix timetenure for contract is represented in days (90, 180, 270) etcmxxToBeMinted or mxxToBeMinted is always in its lowest denomination (8 decimals)For e.g if mxxToBeMinted = 6 MXX, then actual value is 6 * (10 power 8)
